alert.note: Alert for Eddy; Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 26 at 12:06PM MST until February 26 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Eddy County in southeastern New Mexico... Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... Northwestern Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Brewster County in southwestern Texas... Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Ward County in western Texas... Western Winkler County in western Texas... Northern Presidio County in southwestern Texas... Culberson County in southwestern Texas... Loving County in western Texas... * Until 300 PM CST/200 PM MST/. * At 104 PM CST/1204 PM MST/, a dust channel was 7 miles east of Van Horn, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 136 and 247. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 69. Locations impacted include... Hobbs, Carlsbad, Artesia, Lovington, Pecos, Alpine, Kermit, Eunice, Van Horn, Jal, Marfa, Wink, Kent, Tatum, Hope, Toyah, Fort Davis, Pine Springs, Candelaria and Mentone. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
